intro: Sickingia vestita, commonly known as the woolly ice plant, is a succulent native to South Africa. It features fleshy, thick leaves covered in a dense layer of white, woolly hair, which helps reduce water loss in arid environments. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements make it an attractive addition to dry landscapes.
